Cultural Resources, Archeology, Palentology

Cultural Resources are man-made artifacts that have significant historical or cultural importance to a particular group of people. Archaeology involves the study of these artifacts and their role in human activity throughout the historical record. Paleontological Resources are evidence of past life preserved as prehistoric bones or fossils. Paleontologists find and recover these specimens to learn about life on earth prior to there being any written or oral history.

Dudekâ€™s Cultural Resources Consultant Team includes archaeologists, paleontologists, and other scientists and historians who work collaboratively with public agencies, planners, and engineers to identify cost-effective solutions to achieve project objectives while minimizing the potential for historic and prehistoric resource conflicts.
